articles.title: Electronic Health Records Phenotyping
articles.contents:
Welcome
This website contains materials for Biostatistics Workshop in 2022 SSC Annual Meeting Online.
In this workshop, we will introduce statistical learning methods designed to expedite the phenotyping process in order to improve the scalability of EHR research.
Module 1 Exploratory data analysis (EDA) (Exerciese 1)
Module 2 Supervised learning model fitting and evaluation (Exerciese 2)
Module 3 Semi-supervised learning model fitting and evaluation (Exerciese 3)
Module 4 Semi-supervised and weakly-supervised learning model fitting and evaluation (Exerciese 4)
PheCAP
We will use the real EHR data examples from PheCAP, an R package that implements high-throughput phenotyping with electronic health record (EHR) using a common automated pipeline.
Required packages
Here is a list of packages that will be used during the workshop.
Please copy and paste the following code into R Console to check and load the packages.
We are using R version (\(\geq\) 3.6.0).


# Specify the packages from CRAN.
packages <- c(
    "PheCAP",     
    "PheNorm",  
    "MAP", 
    "glmnet",     
    "glmpath",  
    "mclust",
    "tidyverse",  
    "ggplot2",  
    "corrplot",
    "data.table", 
    "mltools",  
    "pROC",
    "parallel",
    "randomForestSRC",
    "e1071"
)

# Load the packages.
# Missing package(s) will be first installed and loaded.  
package.check <- lapply(
  packages,
  FUN = function(x) {
    if (!require(x, character.only = TRUE)) {
      install.packages(x, dependencies = TRUE)
      library(x, character.only = TRUE)
    }
  }
)



Implementation
To start with, please git clone the repository to local.

git clone git@github.com:jlgrons/EHR-Phenotyping-Workshop.git

Resources
Publicly available EHR dataset
PhysioNet
National NLP Clinical Challenges (n2c2) NLP competitions

NLP software
cTAKES
clinspacy
medspacy

Acknowledgments
This website was made with the distill package, drawn mostly from Silvia Canelón’s Sharing Your Work with xaringan.
